page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area is largely agricultural and long-established names suggest that it has always been so. These names, which suggest the previous use of the area, include Hunger Hill, Cocks-hut Hill, Newkennel Plantation, Mill House, and Inn Farm. Most people work in farming-related activities, as farmers or contract workers. Other occupations noted include one gamekeeper, doctors, teachers, ministers of the church, public house employees, cement works employees, lorry and tanker drivers, caterers, and people who live in the area but commute to Derby to follow their occupations. Many of the farms are dairy farms. The most popular cows are Friesians because they have a good milk yield, but there is also a pedigree herd of Ayrshires, a few Guernseys, Jerseys,
